result.markdown:
---
title: "Explorando Dados"
author: "Ricardo Accioly"
date: "2024-05-10"
format:
 html:
    code-link: true
    fig-width: 9
    fig-height: 7
    fig-dpi: 300
knitr:
  opts_chunk: 
    out.width: 90%
    comment: "#>"
---


## Carregando bibliotecas


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
data(iris)
```
:::


## O que temos aqui?


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(iris)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>   Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
#> 1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 2          4.9         3.0          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2  setosa
#> 4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2  setosa
#> 5          5.0         3.6          1.4         0.2  setosa
#> 6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4  setosa
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
iris %>% count(Species)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#>      Species  n
#> 1     setosa 50
#> 2 versicolor 50
#> 3  virginica 50
```


:::
:::


## Quais são as médias?


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  summarize(across(where(is.numeric), ~ mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE)))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   Species    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width
#>   <fct>             <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 setosa             5.01        3.43         1.46       0.246
#> 2 versicolor         5.94        2.77         4.26       1.33 
#> 3 virginica          6.59        2.97         5.55       2.03
```


:::
:::


## Vamos ver se temos alguma relação entre as variáveis


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% ggplot(aes(x=Sepal.Width, y=Sepal.Length, 
                                   color=Species)) + geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06A_files/figure-html/3-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Vamos ver se temos alguma relação entre as variáveis 2


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=Sepal.Width, y=Sepal.Length, color=Species)) +
  geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se=FALSE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06A_files/figure-html/3a-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Vamos ver se temos alguma relação entre as variáveis 3


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% ggplot(aes(x=Petal.Width, y=Petal.Length, 
                                   color=Species)) + geom_point()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06A_files/figure-html/4-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Vamos ver se temos alguma relação entre as variáveis 4


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=Petal.Width, y=Petal.Length, color=Species)) +
  geom_point() + geom_smooth(method = "lm")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06A_files/figure-html/4a-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Vamos ver como se distribui o Petal.Width


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% ggplot(aes(x=Petal.Width, 
                                   fill=Species)) + 
                                   geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06A_files/figure-html/5-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Vamos ver como se distribui o Petal.Length


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=Petal.Length, fill=Species)) + 
  geom_histogram()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06A_files/figure-html/6-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::
